learning_outcomes.description: Describe the core techniques, tools and processes that are used in data science
Design effective data science processes from problem formulation to persuasive storytelling with data
Critically apply data science techniques to analyse, model and visualise different types of data
Compare and discuss technical and ethical aspects of data science projects, and evaluate and reflect on the results

assessments.task_description: Given a dataset(s), students will be required to produce and submit a complete Jupyter Notebook describing how the full data science process has been applied over the dataset(s) and effectively communicate the outcome of their analysis.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectorial

This is a weekly 1 hour live session to reflect and discuss the online content and to provide complementary information to the online content. It is also an opportunity to clarify any aspect of the week's topics.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectorial This is a weekly 1 hour live session to reflect and discuss the online content and to provide complementary information to the online content. It is also an opportunity to clarify any aspect of the week's topics.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Online Content

Students will consume online content (a mix of pre-recorded videos and readings) in preparation for the live lectorial.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 13(05 Aug - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Practical in the Lab

In this sessions, students will work on Jupyter Notebooks to analyse given datasets with the support of demonstrator.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
